question: {name} places {obj}s on {surface}s and {surface2}s. Each {surface} can hold {x} {obj}s while each {surface2} can hold {mult} that. {name} has {n} {obj}s, {k} {surface}s and {kk} {surface2}s. Unfortunately, 2 {surface2}s break. {name} then eats a fraction of {frac} of all the {obj}s. How many more {surface}s does {name} need so he can place all the remaining {obj}s?
